==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|gmh|de}} {{m|gmh|woche}}, from {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|wohha}}, alteration of older {{m|goh|wehha}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*wikǭ}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*weyg-|t=to bend, wind, turn, yield}}. Compare English and Dutch {{m|en|week}}, West Frisian {{m|fy|wike}}, Danish {{m|da|uge}}, Swedish {{m|sv|vecka}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈvɔxə/}} * {{a|Germany}} {{audio|de|De-Woche.ogg}} * {{a|Austria}} {{audio|de|De-at-Woche.ogg}} * {{hyphenation|de|Wo|che}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|f||Wochen|Wöchlein|dim2=Wöchelchen}} # [[week]] {{gloss|period of seven days counting from Monday to Sunday, or from Sunday to Saturday}} #: {{ux|de|ab nächster '''Woche'''|from next '''week''' on|inline=1}} # week {{gloss|any period of seven consecutive days}} #: {{ux|de|schon seit einer '''Woche'''|for a '''week''' already|inline=1}} # week; [[weekdays]] {{gloss|those days of a given week on which most people work}} #: {{ux|de|unter der '''Woche'''|during the '''week'''|inline=1}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|n}} ====Derived terms==== {{der-top}} * {{l|de|Ferienwoche}} * {{l|de|Kalenderwoche}} * {{l|de|Karwoche}} * {{l|de|Osterwoche}} * {{l|de|Quatemberwoche}} {{der-mid}} * {{l|de|Wochenanfang}} * {{l|de|Wochenbeginn}} * {{l|de|Wochenbett}} * {{l|de|Wochenblatt}} * {{l|de|Wochenende}} * {{l|de|wochenlang}} * {{l|de|Wochenschau}} * {{l|de|Wochenzeitschrift}} * {{l|de|Wochenzeitung}} * {{l|de|Wochenwechsel}} * {{l|de|wöchentlich}} * {{l|de|-wöchig}} {{der-bottom}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Time]] [[Category:de:Units of measure]] ---- ==Pennsylvania German== ===Noun=== {{head|pdc|noun form}} # {{plural of|pdc|Woch}}
